entry.title: Asking for open data isn’t open data
entry.summary: Often there is no direct download for the data, but rather an email contact, who in many cases must be emailed separately for each requested dataset.

entry.title: Data collection is hard to keep up to date
entry.summary:
It’s often hard to write an automatic process to download a dataset:

  • URLs change or break
  • Some data is made using JavaScript which only works when a human is present
  • Many datasets are kept behind email or permissions-walls

These barriers mean collecting and updating datasets published by organisations including Ordnance Survey, Environment Agency, Historic England and many local authorities is a manual process.

entry.title: Data is inaccessible
entry.summary: Data needed is seldom found online, with many datasets held locally and in widely varying formats.

entry.title: Data is not always available in bulk
entry.summary: Data is also sometimes only accessible in a limited fashion through proprietary tools, such as a mapping tool for tree preservation orders that lets you search for individual trees but doesn’t display the complete dataset.

entry.title: Data is often hard to trust
entry.summary: Users aren’t always confident that the data will be maintained.

entry.title: Data is often published as statistics
entry.summary: Much of the data is compiled in raw form, but only published by government in the form of statistics.

entry.title: Data often isn't available as data
entry.summary: Often even the most basic information often isn’t available as data.

entry.title: Data use is restricted
entry.summary: Much data is made available under an open government licence, but with additional, restrictive terms.

entry.title: Fear of feedback
entry.summary: The quality of many datasets is poor, and feedback can be a source of improvement.

entry.title: Lack of value seen in publishing data
entry.summary: Some local authorities have seen benefits in publishing open data.

entry.title: The same data is inconsistent across publishers
entry.summary: Often the same specific types of data are defined or formatted differently depending on the publisher.

entry.title: Uncertainty around what data is needed
entry.summary: It’s hard to determine what data is needed to make a better planning application.
